alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:08PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN NEW CASTLE...NORTH CENTRAL CUMBERLAND...CENTRAL SALEM... NORTHWESTERN GLOUCESTER AND SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 508 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wilmington Manor, or over Wilmington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Chester, West Deptford, Pennsville, Carneys Point, Elsmere, Paulsboro, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Woodstown, Alloway, National Park, Swedesboro, Delaware City, Newport, Arden, Stanton, Bear and Talleyville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6, and near mile marker 11. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 4 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 22. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
